definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker
Toreador Song (Votre toast, je peux vous le rendre), famous aria from opera Carmen 卡門|卡门 by Georges Bizet

sentences.english: Most matadors have been seriously injured by a bull.
sentences.chinese: 大部分斗牛士曾经因斗牛而严重受伤。

sentences.english: I like Picasso's drawings of bullfighters.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢毕加索描绘斗牛士的画作。

sentences.english: Villalta - A great bullfighter , he is described in Chapter XII.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的斗牛士，他所描述的第十二章。

sentences.english: As a matador you have a deep connection with the bulls.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名斗牛士，你与公牛有一种深厚的联系。

sentences.english: Carmen becomes tired of Don Jose and falls in love with the handsome matador Escamillo.
sentences.chinese: 卡门逐渐厌弃唐豪塞而爱上了斗牛士埃斯卡米里奥。

sentences.english: In France, the fighter tries to pick a ribbon from the horns of the bull.
sentences.chinese: 在法国，斗牛士极力取下牛角上的绸带。

sentences.english: The tenor was singing the "toreador song" from carmen.
sentences.chinese: 男高音歌手正在唱《卡门》中的“斗牛士之歌”。

sentences.english: In fact, most matadors begin training at a young age.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，大多数斗牛士的训练从很小的时候就开始了。

sentences.english: The bull was irritated by the matador.
sentences.chinese: 这头牛被斗牛士激怒了。

sentences.english: The matador profiled,his thin silver blade raised.
sentences.chinese: 斗牛士左肩对着牛，举起他的锋利的银色尖刀。

sentences.english: Act IV Back in Seville, the crowd cheers the bullfighters on their way to the arena.
sentences.chinese: 第四幕在塞维尔，群众为斗牛士欢呼。

sentences.english: And here are 20 from Matador members who are experienced volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 这里有20位做过志愿者的《斗牛士》杂志社的成员。

sentences.english: The matador had a narrow escape.
sentences.chinese: 这个斗牛士真是死里逃生。

sentences.english: Many times, matadors can get seriously injured while fighting with the bull.
sentences.chinese: 在与公牛的激烈搏斗中，斗牛士常常会身受重伤。

pinyin: Yi1 bi3 li4 ya4 Ban4 dao3
